channel.title: The man with the scythe. real or fake?
channel.description:
[img]http://img295.imageshack.us/img295/1009/sm00739dd768cz6.jpg[/img] The man with the scythe, walking around the earth and harvesting death ppl's souls. Walking among us, dressed black, and ALLWAYS carry hes scythe to end ppl's life and harvest their soul.
is he real or is it a halloween joke? i sure do belive that hes real, i allmost think ive seen him. what do you think about him?

item.title: The man with the scythe. real or fake?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Dell451, some people portray him as the Grim Reaper, other give him the name Death, which is much more Elusive. I don’t necessarily believe there is a being such as this, but, there can be mass murderers who pass off as this Sinister creature.

Read full topic

item.title: The man with the scythe. real or fake?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

The portrayal of the scythe originates from a Hellenistic etymological misconception relating the god Cronus with time. Cronus was a harvest deity who is often shown with a sickle, which he also uses to castrate his father, Uranus. Etymologists from the Hellenistic period erroneously correlated Cronus with time due to the similarity with the prefix chrono-. From this mistake, Cronus was often depicted as Father Time, carrying a scythe, which is a harvesting tool related to the sickle. The characters of Father Time and the Grim Reaper frequently overlap, leading to the common portrayal of the Grim Reaper brandishing a scythe.

Is has become a stereotype because of a mistake. I don’t doubt that you have seen it, only because you made this topic in the first place. An un-dead skeleton with a sickle however, does not exist.

Read full topic
item.source: The man with the scythe. real or fake?
